poem:
### The Lens of Venus

smooth arc of a serve,  
the frame captures light—
Venus by the net  
probing pixels, prints  
with a conscious gaze.

scroll your moments, she says,
through screens  
of fleeting time.

what artistry—
the witness  
of eyes to the world,  
translated by  
a champion's touch.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Tennis ace Venus Williams serves up a show all about art Picks of the week Widening the Lens: Photography, Ecology, and the Contemporary LandscapeWidely available, all episodes out nowTennis champion, arts patron and now podcaster – Venus Williams hosts this thoughtful series from the Carnegie Museum of Art in Pittsburgh. “Look at the photos on your phone,” she requests in the opener. “Go ahead, give them a scroll … ” She then speaks with experts". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
